name: sentinelone
label: SentinelOne
description: SentinelOne that provides threat detection, hunting, and response features that enable organizations to discover vulnerabilities and protect IT operations. This connector facilitates automated operations related to events, threats, agents, query, and applications.

fields.title: Server URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the SentinelOne REST endpoint to which you will connect and perform the automated operations.
fields.name: host_name

fields.title: API Token
fields.description:
Specify the API token that is required to access the SentinelOne REST endpoint.
Important: The minimum role required for the user to use the API endpoint is "Site Viewer".
fields.name: apiToken

fields.title: API Version
fields.description: Specify the version of the API that you are using to access the SentinelOne REST endpoint.
fields.name: api_version

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Verify SSL connection to the SentinelOne API endpoint. By default, this option is set as True.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Create Query And Get Query ID
operations.description: Starts a deep visibility Query and retrieves the Query ID from SentinelOne based on the query, date range, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.description: Query that is a free-text search term that will match applicable attributes (sub-string match) in Sentinel one based on which you want to retrieve the query ID from SentinelOne
parameters.name: query
parameters.tooltip: The query string for which to return events.

parameters.title: From Date
parameters.description: The start date of the query from when you want to retrieve the query ID from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.tooltip: Query start date, for example, "2019-08-03T04:49:26.257525Z". Limited to 93 days ago.

parameters.title: To Date
parameters.description: The end date of the query till when you want to retrieve the query ID from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: toDate
parameters.tooltip: Query end date, for example, "2019-08-03T04:49:26.257525Z".

parameters.title: Group IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's group IDs based on which you want to retrieve the query ID from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: groupIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's group IDs.

parameters.title: Tenant
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True to indicate a tenant scope in the query.
parameters.name: tenant
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True to indicate a tenant scope in the query.

parameters.title: Query Type
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of the query used by deep visibility in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: queryType
parameters.tooltip: Type of the query used by deep visibility in SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Account IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's accounts based on which you want to retrieve the query ID from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: accountIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's accounts.

parameters.title: Site IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's sites based on which you want to retrieve the query ID from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: siteIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's sites.

operations.title: Cancel Running Query
operations.description: Stops a deep visibility query that is running on SentinelOne based on the query ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Query ID
parameters.description: The ID of a deep visibility query that you want to stop in SentinelOne. When you create a query in SentinelOne you get its QueryID.
parameters.name: queryId

operations.title: Get Query Status
operations.description: Retrieves the status of the deep visibility query from SentinelOne based on the query ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Query ID
parameters.description: The ID of the query whose status you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. When you create a query in SentinelOne you get its QueryID.
parameters.name: queryId

operations.title: Get Events
operations.description: Retrieves the deep visibility events associated with a query from SentinelOne based on the query ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Query ID
parameters.description: ID of the query whose associated events you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. When you create a query in SentinelOne you get its QueryID.
parameters.name: queryId
parameters.tooltip: ID of the query whose associated events you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return. Range should be between 1 to 1000.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Skips the specified number of results from the total results.
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Skips the specified number of results (0-1000) from the total results.

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) Cursor position returned by the last request. You can use this parameter instead of using Skip Records parameter. Cursor currently supports Sort By with createdAt, pid, and processStartTime.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. For e.g YWdlbnRfaWQ6NTgwMjkzODE=

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result (events).
parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.tooltip: Sort events by field.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.description: (Optional) Sorting order of the result (events), choose between Ascending or Descending.
parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.tooltip: Sorting order of the result.

parameters.title: Sub Query
parameters.description: (Optional) Create a sub query to run on the data that was already pulled.
parameters.name: subQuery
parameters.tooltip: Create a sub query to run on the data that was already pulled.

operations.title: Get Events By Type
operations.description: Retrieves the deep visibility events associated with a query from SentinelOne based on the query ID, event type, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Query ID
parameters.description: The ID of the query whose associated events you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. When you create a query in SentinelOne you get its QueryID.
parameters.name: queryId
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the query whose associated events you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Event Type
parameters.description: Event type by which you want to filter the results (events). You can choose between the following event types: Events, File, IP, URL, DNS, Process, Registry, Scheduled task, Logins, or Indicators.
parameters.name: event_type
parameters.tooltip: Event type by which you want to filter the results (events). You can choose between the following event types: Events, File, IP, URL, DNS, Process, Registry, Scheduled task, Logins, or Indicators.

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return. Range should be between 1 to 1000.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Skips the specified number of results from the total results.
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Skips the specified number of results (0-1000) from the total results.

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) Cursor position returned by the last request. You can use this parameter instead of using Skip Records parameter. Cursor currently supports Sort By with createdAt, pid, and processStartTime.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. For e.g YWdlbnRfaWQ6NTgwMjkzODE=

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result (events).
parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.tooltip: Sort events by field.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.description: (Optional) Sorting order of the result (events), choose between Ascending or Descending.
parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.tooltip: Sorting order of the result.

parameters.title: Sub Query
parameters.description: (Optional) Create a sub query to run on the data that was already pulled.
parameters.name: subQuery
parameters.tooltip: Create a sub query to run on the data that was already pulled.

operations.title: Threat Forensic Details
operations.description: Retrieves detailed forensics data for a specific threat on SentinelOne based on the threat ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: The ID of the threat whose forensic details you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: threat_id

operations.title: Get Threat Forensics
operations.description: Retrieves forensics data for a specific threat on SentinelOne based on the threat ID and export format you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: ID of the threat for which you want to retrieve the forensic data.
parameters.name: threat_id

parameters.title: Site IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's sites whose threat data you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: siteIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's sites

parameters.title: Group IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's groups whose threat data you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: groupIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's groups

parameters.title: Account IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's accounts whose threat data you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: accountIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's accounts

operations.title: Export Threat
operations.description: Exports threats along with its associated threats, in the CSV or JSON formation, for a specific threat on SentinelOne based on the threat ID and export format you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: The ID of the threat whose threats along with its associated threats you want to export in the CSV, JSON, or RAW format from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: threat_id

parameters.title: Export Format
parameters.description: Format in which you want to export the threat data. You can choose between the following formats: CSV, RAW, or JSON.
parameters.name: export_format

operations.title: Get Threat Seen on Network
operations.description: Retrieves "seen on network" details for a specific threat in SentinelOne based on the threat ID and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: The ID of the threat whose "seen on network data" you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: threat_id

parameters.title: Site IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's sites whose "seen on network data" you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: siteIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's sites.

parameters.title: Group IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's groups whose "seen on network data" you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: groupIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's groups

parameters.title: Account IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's account whose "seen on network data" you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: accountIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's account.

operations.title: Free Text
operations.description: Retrieves a metadata list of all the available free-text filters in SentinelOne

operations.title: Get Application Count
operations.description: Retrieves the count of applications from SentinelOne number of applications by risk level or filters and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Get Count By
parameters.description: Filter based on which you want to retrieve the application count from SentinelOne. You can choose between Risk Levels or Filters. By default, this is set as Risk Level.
parameters.name: filterBy

parameters.title: Site IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's sites whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: siteIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's sites

parameters.title: Group IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's groups whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: groupIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's groups

parameters.title: Account IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's accounts whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: accountIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's accounts

parameters.title: Agent Machine Types
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of agent machine whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following agent machine types: Unknown, Desktop, Laptop, or Server.
parameters.name: agentMachineTypes

parameters.title: Application IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated application IDs accounts whose application count you want to retrieve, per filter value, from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated application IDs

parameters.title: Application Types
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of application whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following application types: App, Kb, Patch, ChromeExtension, EdgeExtension, FirefoxExtension, or SafariExtension.
parameters.name: types

parameters.title: Is Decommissioned
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True if the status of the agent whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne is set as "Decommissioned".
parameters.name: agentIsDecommissioned
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True if the status of the agent whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne is set as "Decommissioned".

parameters.title: Risk Levels
parameters.description: (Optional) Level of risks whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following risk levels: None, Low, Medium, High, or Critical.
parameters.name: riskLevels
parameters.tooltip: Level of risks whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: OS Types
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Type of the OS used by the application. You can choose between the following os types: MacOS, Windows_Legacy, Linux or Windows.
parameters.name: osTypes
parameters.description: Type of OS whose application count you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following os types: Macos, Windows_Legacy, Linux. or Windows.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: extra_parameters
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.
parameters.description: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Get CVEs
operations.description: Retrieves all known CVEs for applications from SentinelOne based on the input parameters you have specified. Note: This is available for complete SKU only.

parameters.title: Internal CVE IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated internal CVE IDs on which you want to filter the CVEs retrieved using this operation from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated internal CVE IDs.

parameters.title: Global CVE IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated global CVE IDs on which you want to filter the CVEs retrieved using this operation from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: cveIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated global CVE IDs.

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of results, per page.

parameters.title: Skip Count
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to avoid calculating the total number of results, which results in speeding up the execution time.
parameters.name: skipCount
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to avoid calculating the total number of results.

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result. You can choose between the following fields: ID, PublishedAt, AgentID, or ApplicationID.
parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.tooltip: Name of the field on which you want to sort the result.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.description: (Optional) Sorting order of the results, choose between Ascending or Descending.
parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.tooltip: Sorting order of the results.

parameters.title: Count Only
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to only retrieve the total number of items, without any of the actual objects, from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: countOnly
parameters.placeholder: Enable to return the total number of items.

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. For e.g YWdlbnRfaWQ6NTgwMjkzODE=

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: extra_parameters
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Export Applications Risk
operations.description: Exports installed applications and CVE list from SentinelOne based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Site IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's site IDs to export application risks from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: siteIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's site IDs.

parameters.title: Group IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's group IDs to export application risks from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: groupIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's group IDs.

parameters.title: Account IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's account IDs to export application risks from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: accountIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's account IDs.

parameters.title: Size Between
parameters.description: (Optional) Size range of the application between which you want to filter the application risks. You can specify the size range in bytes from 1024 to 104856.
parameters.name: size__between
parameters.tooltip: Filter application size range between 1024 to 104856.

parameters.title: Agent Machine Types
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of agent machine whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following agent machine types: Unknown, Desktop, Laptop, or Server.
parameters.name: agentMachineTypes
parameters.tooltip: Type of agent machine whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Application IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) The ID of the agent application whose installed applications and CVEs list you want to export from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: Comma separated list of IDs.

parameters.title: Application Types
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of application whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following application types: App, Kb, Patch, ChromeExtension, EdgeExtension, FirefoxExtension, or SafariExtension.
parameters.name: types
parameters.tooltip: Type of application whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Is Decommissioned
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True if the status of the agent whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne is set as "Decommissioned".
parameters.name: agentIsDecommissioned
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True if the status of the agent whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne is set as "Decommissioned".

parameters.title: Risk Levels
parameters.description: (Optional) Level of risks whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following risk levels: None, Low, Medium, High, or Critical.
parameters.name: riskLevels
parameters.tooltip: Level of risks whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: OS Types
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of OS whose application risks you want to export from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following os types: MacOS, Windows Legacy, Linux, or Windows.
parameters.name: osTypes

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: extra_parameters
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Get Applications
operations.description: Retrieves a list of all installed applications per endpoint, including risk levels, from SentinelOne based on the input parameters you have specified. Note: This is available for complete SKU only.

parameters.title: Agent Machine Types
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of endpoint machine whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following agent machine types: Unknown, Desktop, Laptop, or Server.
parameters.name: agentMachineTypes

parameters.title: Application IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) The ID of the agent application whose installed applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: Comma separated list of IDs.

parameters.title: Is Decommissioned
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True if the status of the agent whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne is set as "Decommissioned".
parameters.name: agentIsDecommissioned
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True if the status of the agent whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne is set as "Decommissioned".

parameters.title: Application Types
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of application whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following application types: App, Kb, Patch, ChromeExtension, EdgeExtension, FirefoxExtension, or SafariExtension.
parameters.name: types
parameters.tooltip: Type of application whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following application types: App, Kb, Patch, ChromeExtension, EdgeExtension, FirefoxExtension, or SafariExtension.

parameters.title: Risk Levels
parameters.description: (Optional) Level of risks whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following risk levels: None, Low, Medium, High, or Critical.
parameters.name: riskLevels
parameters.tooltip: Level of risks whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.

parameters.description: (Optional) Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Limit number of returned items (1-1000).

parameters.title: Skip Count
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to avoid calculating the total number of results, which results in speeding up the execution time.
parameters.name: skipCount
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to avoid calculating the total number of results, which results in speeding up the execution time.

parameters.title: Sort By
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the field on which you want to sort the result. You can choose between the following fields: ID, InstallAt, Type, Name, Publisher, Version, Size, AgentComputerName. or Risklevel.
parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.tooltip: Name of the field on which you want to sort the result.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.description: (Optional) Sorting order of the results, choose between Ascending or Descending.
parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.tooltip: Sorting order of the results

parameters.title: Count Only
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option to only retrieve the total number of items, without any of the actual objects, from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: countOnly
parameters.tooltip: Select this option to only retrieve the total number of items, without any of the actual objects, from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: OS Types
parameters.description: (Optional) Type of OS whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following os types: Macos, Windows Legacy, Linux, or Windows.
parameters.name: osTypes
parameters.tooltip: Type of OS whose applications you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose between the following os types: Macos, Windows Legacy, Linux, or Windows.

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.

parameters.tooltip: The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. For e.g YWdlbnRfaWQ6NTgwMjkzODE=

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: extra_parameters
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Get Application CVEs
operations.description: Retrieves all known CVEs for a specific application, along with application and endpoint information, from SentinelOne, based on the application ID you have specified. Note: This is available for complete SKU only.

parameters.title: Application ID
parameters.description: The ID of the agent application whose application CVEs you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: agent_application_id

operations.title: Mark Threat as Benign
operations.description: Marks an identified threat as safe in SentinelOne based on the threat ID, target scope, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Target Scope
parameters.description: Scope of the target that you want to mark as safe in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: targetScope
parameters.tooltip: Specify a scope of the target that you want to mark as safe

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: The ID of the threat that you want to mark as safe in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: Specify a ID of the threat.

parameters.title: Agent ID
parameters.description: (Optional) The ID of the agent on which the threat has been identified.
parameters.name: agentId
parameters.tooltip: Specify a ID of the agent.

parameters.title: Content Hash
parameters.description: (Optional) The Hash ID of the file associated with the threat that you want to mark as safe in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: contentHash
parameters.tooltip: Specify ID of the file hash.

parameters.title: Threat Name
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the threat that requires to be marked as safe in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.tooltip: Specify a name of the threat that requires to be marked as safe

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

operations.title: Mitigate Threat
operations.description: Mitigates identified threats in the SentinelOne system based on the threat ID, action, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.description: Select the action that you want to perform on the specified threat. You can choose between the following actions: Kill, Quarantine, Un-Quarantine, Remediate, or Rollback-Remediation.
parameters.name: action

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: The ID of the threat on which you want to take the specified action.
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the threat on which you want to take the specified action.

parameters.title: Agent ID
parameters.description: (Optional) The ID of the agent on which the threat has been identified.
parameters.name: agentId
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the agent on which the threat has been identified.

parameters.title: Content Hash
parameters.description: (Optional) The Hash ID of the file associated with the threat that requires mitigation.
parameters.name: contentHash
parameters.tooltip: The Hash ID of the file associated with the threat that requires mitigation.

parameters.title: Threat Name
parameters.description: (Optional) Name of the threat that requires mitigation.
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.tooltip: Name of the threat that requires mitigation.

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

operations.title: List All Threats
operations.description: List all threats identified by SentinelOne on agents. You can additionally filter out the results by specifying the agent ID or the threat name.

parameters.title: Agent ID
parameters.description: (Optional) The ID of the agent whose threats you want to list.
parameters.name: agentIds
parameters.tooltip: The ID of the agent whose threats you want to list.

parameters.title: Created After
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created after the specified timestamp.
parameters.name: createdAt__gt
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created after the specified timestamp.

parameters.title: Updated After
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been updated after the specified timestamp.
parameters.name: updatedAt__gt
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been updated after the specified timestamp.

parameters.title: Content Hash
parameters.description: (Optional) The Hash ID of the file associated with the threat.
parameters.name: contentHash
parameters.tooltip: The Hash ID of the file associated with the threat.

parameters.title: Threat Name
parameters.description: (Optional) The name of the threat that you want to search for on all agents on SentinelOne.
parameters.name: displayName
parameters.tooltip: The name of the threat that you want to search for on all agents on SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Skips the specified number of results (0-1000) from the total results.
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Skips the specified number of results (0-1000) from the total results.

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. For e.g YWdlbnRfaWQ6NTgwMjkzODE=

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Fetch Threats
operations.description: List all threats or specific threats identified by SentinelOne on agents filtered by the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Created After
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created after the specified timestamp.
parameters.name: createdAt__gt
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been created after the specified timestamp.

parameters.title: Updated After
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been updated after the specified timestamp.
parameters.name: updatedAt__gt
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Datetime using which you want to filter the result set to only include only those items that have been updated after the specified timestamp.

parameters.title: Query
parameters.description: (Optional) A query is a free-text search term that you can use to match applicable attributes (sub-string match) in SentinelOne based on which you want to retrieve the threats from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: query
parameters.tooltip: A query is a free-text search term that you can use to match applicable attributes (sub-string match) in SentinelOne based on which you want to retrieve the threats from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Get Threat Events List
operations.description: List all threat events identified by SentinelOne on agents. You can additionally filter out the results by specifying the threat ID or other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: The ID of the threat whose events details you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: threat_id

parameters.title: Event ID
parameters.description: (Optional) The ID of the event whose threat events you want to list.
parameters.name: eventId
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) The ID of the event whose threat events you want to list.

parameters.title: Event Type
parameters.description: (Optional) The type of the event whose threat events you want to list.
parameters.name: eventTypes
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) The Type of the event whose threat events you want to list.

parameters.title: Event SubType
parameters.description: (Optional) The SubType of the event whose threat events you want to list.
parameters.name: eventSubTypes
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) The SubType of the event whose threat events you want to list.

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.description: (Optional) The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Count of results (0-1000) that this operation should skip from the total results. For iterating over a large number of items, more than 1000, use the Cursor parameter.
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Count of results (0-1000) that this operation should skip from the total results. For iterating over a large number of items, more than 1000, use the Cursor parameter.

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) This parameter is used only if a previous operation has returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: This parameter is used only if a previous operation has returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. For e.g YWdlbnRfaWQ6NTgwMjkzODE=

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve a threats from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Get Threat Details
operations.description: Retrieve the details for a specified threat from SentinelOne based on the threat ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: The ID of the threat whose details you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: ids

operations.title: Fetch Threat File
operations.description: Retrieves a file associated with the threat that matches filter criteria.

parameters.title: Threat IDs
parameters.description: Specify comma-separated threat IDs whose details you want to retrieve as a file from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: Specify comma-separated threat IDs whose details you want to retrieve as a file from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Password
parameters.description: Specify the file's encryption password.
parameters.name: password
parameters.tooltip: Specify the file's encryption password.

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify additional fields, in JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve threat files from SentinelOne.
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify additional fields, in JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve threat files from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Get Threat Timeline
operations.description: Retrieves timeline details for a specified threat from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.description: Specify the threat ID whose timeline details you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: Specify the threat ID whose timeline details you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Sort Order
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the sorting order of the results. You can choose from following options: Ascending or Descending.
parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Select the sorting order of the results. You can choose from following options: Ascending or Descending.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the initial number of results to skip from total results.
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Skips the specified number of results (0-1000) from the total results.

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: Maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return. Range should be between 1 to 1000.

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) This parameter is used only if a previous operation has returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: This parameter is used only if a previous operation has returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. For e.g YWdlbnRfaWQ6NTgwMjkzODE=

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: additional_fields
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Additional fields, in JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve threat timeline details from SentinelOne.
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional fields, in JSON format, based on which you want to retrieve threat timeline details from SentinelOne.

operations.title: Add Note to a Threat
operations.description: Adds a note to one or multiple threats in SentinelOne based on the threat ID and the note that you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.name: threatID
parameters.description: Specify the threat ID to which you want to add the note in SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Note
parameters.name: note
parameters.description: Specify the note to add in SentinelOne.

operations.title: Change Incident Status
operations.description: Changes Incident Status on SentinelOne based on the threat ID and incident status that you have specified.

parameters.title: Threat ID
parameters.name: threatID
parameters.description: Specify the theat ID whose incident status you want to change in SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Incident Status
parameters.description: Specify the new status to which you want to update the incident to in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: incidentStatus

operations.title: Get Hash Details
operations.description: Retrieve the details for a specified hash from SentinelOne based on the Hash ID you have specified.

parameters.title: Hash ID
parameters.description: The ID (SHA1 only) of the hash whose details you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: hash_id
parameters.tooltip: The ID (SHA1 only) of the hash.

operations.title: Agent Action
operations.description: Actions that you want to perform on an agent in Sentinel One based on the action, agent IDs, and other input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Action
parameters.description: Select the action that you want to perform on the specified agent in SentinelOne. You can choose between the following actions: Isolate Agent Network, Decommission Agent, Uninstall Agent, or Shutdown Agent.
parameters.name: action

parameters.title: Agent IDs
parameters.description: List of comma-separated agent IDs on which you want to perform actions in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent IDs.

parameters.title: Group IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent's group IDs on which you want to perform actions in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: groupIds
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent's group IDs

parameters.title: Is Decommissioned
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to perform actions on SentinelOne is set as "Decommissioned".
parameters.name: isDecommissioned
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to perform actions on SentinelOne is set as "Decommissioned".

parameters.title: Is Uninstalled
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to perform actions on SentinelOne is set as "Uninstalled".
parameters.name: isUninstalled
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to perform actions on SentinelOne is set as "Uninstalled".

operations.title: Abort Agent Scan
operations.description: Initiates scanning on a specified agent system or all agents in SentinelOne based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Agent IDs
parameters.description: (Optional) List of comma-separated agent IDs on which you want to abort the scan in SentinelOne.
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: List of comma-separated agent IDs.

parameters.title: Is Active
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to abort the scan is set as "Active".
parameters.name: isActive
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to abort the scan is set as "Active".

parameters.title: Is Infected
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to abort the scan is set as "Infected".
parameters.name: infected
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to abort the scan is set as "Infected".

parameters.title: Is Decommissioned
parameters.description: (Optional) Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to abort the scan is set as "Decommissioned".
parameters.name: isDecommissioned
parameters.tooltip: Set it to True if the status of the agent on which you want to abort the scan is set as "Decommissioned".

parameters.title: Computer Name Like
parameters.description: (Optional) Abort the scan only on those agents that match the specified computer name.
parameters.name: computerName__like
parameters.tooltip: Abort the scan only on those agents that match the specified computer name.

parameters.title: Agent Memory Less Than (MB)
parameters.description: (Optional) Aborts the scan only those agents whose memory size is lesser than given input from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: totalMemory__lte
parameters.tooltip: Aborts the scan only those agents whose memory size is lesser than given input from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Agent Memory Greater Than (MB)
parameters.description: (Optional) Aborts the scan only those agents whose memory size is greater than given input from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: totalMemory__gte
parameters.tooltip: Aborts the scan only those agents whose memory size is greater than given input from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Agent Core Count Less Than
parameters.description: (Optional) Aborts the scan only those agents whose core count size is lesser than given input from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: coreCount__lte
parameters.tooltip: Aborts the scan only those agents whose core count size is lesser than given input from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Agent Core Count Greater Than
parameters.description: (Optional) Aborts the scan only those agents whose core count size is greater than given input from SentinelOne.
parameters.name: coreCount__gte
parameters.tooltip: Aborts the scan only those agents whose core count size is greater than given input from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Agent Version
parameters.description: (Optional) The version of the agent on which you want to abort the scan.
parameters.name: agentVersions
parameters.tooltip: The version of the agent on which you want to abort the scan.

parameters.title: OS Type
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the OS type of the agent in the SentinelOne on which you want to abort the scan. You can choose from the following options: Linux, MacOS, Windows, or Windows Legacy.
parameters.name: osTypes

parameters.title: Network Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the network status of the agent in the SentinelOne on which you want to abort the scan. You can choose from the following options: Connected, Disconnected, Connecting, or Disconnecting.
parameters.name: networkStatuses

parameters.title: Additional Fields
parameters.name: extra_parameters
parameters.tooltip: Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to abort scan in SentinelOne.
parameters.description: (Optional) Additional fields, in the JSON format, based on which you want to abort scan in SentinelOne.

parameters.tooltip: The message that you want to broadcast to an agent or a list of agents in SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Computer Name Like

parameters.title: Agent Memory Less Than (MB)

parameters.title: Agent Version
parameters.description: (Optional) The version of the agent that you want to retrieve from SentinelOne.

parameters.title: Network Status
parameters.description: (Optional) Select the network status of the agent that you want to retrieve from SentinelOne. You can choose from the following options: Connected, Disconnected, Connecting, or Disconnecting.
parameters.name: networkStatuses

parameters.title: Limit Records
parameters.decription: (Optional) The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.
parameters.name: limit
parameters.tooltip: The maximum number of results, per page, that this operation should return.

parameters.title: Offset
parameters.description: (Optional) Skips the specified number of results (0-1000) from the total results. For iterating over a large number of items, more than 1000), use the 'Cursor' parameter.
parameters.name: skip
parameters.tooltip: Skips the specified number of results (0-1000) from the total results.

parameters.title: Cursor
parameters.description: (Optional) The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. It is useful for iterating over a large number of items. You can use this parameter instead of using the 'Skip Records' parameter.
parameters.name: cursor
parameters.tooltip: The 'Cursor' parameter is used only if a previous operation had returned a partial result. If a previous response contains a cursor element, then the value of the cursor element includes a cursor parameter that specifies a starting point to use for subsequent calls. For e.g YWdlbnRfaWQ6NTgwMjkzODE=

operations.title: Custom API Endpoint
operations.description: Allows querying a custom API endpoint in SentinelOne based on the endpoint and request you have specified.

parameters.title: API Endpoint
parameters.name: endpoint
parameters.description: Specify the API Endpoint using which you want to make the API call. NOTE: The API endpoint for SentinelOne must be specified in the following format: https://<server_url>/web/api/<api_version>/threats
parameters.tooltip: Specify the API Endpoint using which you want to make the API call. NOTE: The API endpoint for SentinelOne must be specified in the following format: https://<server_url>/web/api/<api_version>/threats

parameters.title: HTTP method
parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Select the HTTP method to be used for the API call. You can choose from following options: GET or POST.
parameters.tooltip: Select the HTTP method to be used for the API call. You can choose from following options: GET or POST.

parameters.title: Request Parameters/Body
parameters.tooltip: (Optional) Specify the Request Parameters or the Request Body that you want to send with the GET or POST API call, respectively.
parameters.name: body
parameters.description: (Optional) Specify the Request Parameters or the Request Body that you want to send with the GET or POST API call, respectively.
